intro: Villarsia exaltata, commonly known as the tall villarsia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has palmate leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Villarsia exaltata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
